results.title: North of 60 east
results.creator_credit: E.L. Burnell, T.R. Wagstaff, Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: On patrol with the Royal Canadian Mounted Police of the eastern Canadian Arctic, north of the 60th parallel. This film shows the day-to-day routine of constables who police the vast area that includes Baffin and Ellesmere Islands. For those who might choose northern service, the film provides clear impressions of the requirements of this detachment; for the general audience it gives an interesting overall view of the people, life and environment in the eastern Arctic.
results.creator_credit_for_label: E.L. Burnell, T.R. Wagstaff, Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: No toothache for Eskimos
results.brief_description: A 5-minute version of “Let’s keep our teeth” suitable for young children (8-11 years of age) which shows the tough primitive diet of the Eskimos. Children are attracted by the food sequences which, linked with points about the reasons for tooth decay, make a quick transition from amusement to instruction. Vividly portrays life in the Arctic.

results.title: No other choice
results.creator_credit: Krishna Singh and United Nations Films
results.brief_description: Impressions of the value and necessity of international cooperation, showing how more advanced countries can help in health, education and economic development of backward and depressed parts of the world. It is argued that cooperation in constructive work and toleration of differences in pursuit of common welfare are the best ways to resolve conflict of national interests. Narrated by Alexander Scourby

results.title: Nikkolina
results.creator_credit: Glen Salzman, Rebecca Yates, Cineflics and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Deals with the conflict of one’s own personal goals and one’s family by presenting a story about an American-born girl in a Greek immigrant family, and her resolution of the conflict between a skating event and a family wedding.

results.title: The Newfoundlanders: voices from the sea
results.creator_credit: Zale Magder, Magder Film Productions and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a film about Newfoundland roots, culture and its present-day position in Canada as a significant maritime region community and as an important but little-known part of our history.

results.title: Newfoundland scene: a tale of outport adventure (D)
results.brief_description: NB: CONTAINS DISTURBING SCENES OF THE SLAUGHTER OF BABY SEALS. A study of Newfoundland’s natural resources and primary industry. Cod fishing, sealing and whaling are the focus of this documentary. Also looked at is transportation by Eskimo sled. Includes scenes of Labrador Retrievers, a malemute dog sled team mutinying against its leader causing injfires, the light from a lighthouse and a Newfoundland outport wharf in the misty dawn. (Awards: Canadian Film Award, 1951)

results.title: New uses for Seaweed
results.brief_description: A brief account of the uses to which alginates, which are obtained from seaweed, are being put - from foodstuffs to toothpaste. A fine synthetic fibre, spun from the jelly is used in the manufacture of light-weight woollen materials.

results.title: The New South Asia
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser, National Film Board of Canada and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description: A report on social and economic conditions in the five nations of southern Asia. The film portrays the surge of independence and determination to work out their own future which has permeated every phase of national life for this one-fourth of the world’s population, and which is bringing advances in health and living standards. The assistance of the United Nations in providing the knowledge and the plans with which to develop education, social welfare, agriculture and industry is shown.
